meanings.definition: Third person singular present of go.
meanings.sent1: She goes to school every day.
meanings.sent2: The train goes fast on the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The cat goes outside to chase birds.
meanings.sent4: Time goes by quickly when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The sun goes down in the evening.

meanings.sent1: The car goes down the street smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The river goes around the bend.
meanings.sent3: The ball goes up and then comes back down.
meanings.sent4: The music goes from soft to loud.
meanings.sent5: The airplane goes through the clouds.

meanings.sent1: The road goes all the way to the mountains.
meanings.sent2: Her hand goes out to shake yours.
meanings.sent3: The tree's branches go high up in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The line of people goes around the block.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread goes through the house.

meanings.definition: To be in the process of moving.
meanings.sent1: The turtle goes slowly across the sand.
meanings.sent2: The clouds go across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The ants go in a line to find food.
meanings.sent4: The shadows go along the wall as the sun sets.
meanings.sent5: The boat goes gently on the calm water.
